7/11/00
Three successive quakes hit Natanz, Isfahan
Kashan, Isfahan Prov., July 11, IRNA -- Three successive earthquakes measuring 3.6, 3 and 4 degrees on the open-ended Richter scale respectively hit the southeastern part of the city of Natanz in this central province on Tuesday morning.

The seismological base of the Geophysics Institute of Tehran University registered the quakes at 03:00, 03:17 and 03:21 hours local time (22:30, 22:47 and 22:51 hours GMT), respectively.

When the earthquakes hit the city of Ardestan, the local people rushed out of their houses and spent the whole night outdoors.

Governor of Ardestan Reza Aqdaie told IRNA that the quakes inflicted minor damage to several houses in the city.

He added that special teams have been dispatched to the region to evaluate probable damage to rural areas.

Ardestan, with over 50,000 population, is located in southeastern Natanz.
